Nice work!
@gtoonstra can you retrigger the build? (empty commit works)
@bolkedebruin : Hope this works. Now squash it?
@gtoonstra, if you do not mind, yes please.
@artwr @bolkedebruin  Done.

+1, please squash commits

@r39132 @criccomini @msumit Could I get some more eyes on this PR

I propose we do not let the perfect become the enemy of the good and merge this as-is (after squashing).  Automatic refreshes are trickier to get right and can be added in a new PR without invalidating what's been done already.

@biellls Closing for now. Please reopen when you have time!
@jlowin FYI, in case you have input here!

@cheddar As part of Cold Case PR Clean up, I am reviewing all PRs older than 2 weeks. We have reduced open PRs from >110 to ~30 : https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/AIRFLOW/Cold-Case+PR+Resolution

Is this PR still needed? If so, can you rebase. A lot of your changes have already been submitted in other PRs. Pls respond within the next 5 days, else I will close this PR.
@gtoonstra the pr needs to be updated due to another merge.
@bolkedebruin : Rebased onto master, checks running now.
Closed this. Please open a new PR with just the tests.
@r39132 : Alternative fix for AIRFLOW-450. See https://github.com/apache/incubator-airflow/pull/1753

@thoralf-gutierrez are you still looking to get this PR merged?
Cool! Testing!

@gtoonstra I am getting the error below. Unfortunately, you cannot expect people to run `airflow initdb` or `airflow resetdb` as part of upgrading to the next release of airflow. They will simply run `airflow upgrade`. Hence, you need to add an alembic migration to change this value in addition to what you have changed in this PR. ``` -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Starting attempt 1 of 2 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- [2016-11-17 17:51:41,673] {models.py:1273} INFO - Executing on 2016-11-10 00:00:00 [2016-11-17 17:51:41,703] {http_operator.py:78} INFO - Calling HTTP method [2016-11-17 17:51:41,712] {base_hook.py:67} INFO - Using connection to: https://www.google.com/ [2016-11-17 17:51:41,720] {http_hook.py:77} INFO - Sending 'POST' to url: https://www.google.com/?json=%7B"key":"value"%7D [2016-11-17 17:51:41,720] {connectionpool.py:805} INFO - Starting new HTTPS connection (1): www.google.com [2016-11-17 17:51:41,951] {http_hook.py:102} ERROR - HTTP error: Method Not Allowed [2016-11-17 17:51:41,952] {http_hook.py:108} ERROR - Error 405 (Method Not Allowed)!!1

405. That’s an error.

The request method POST is inappropriate for the URL /?json=%7B%22key%22:%22value%22%7D. That’s all we know. [2016-11-17 17:51:41,952] {models.py:1342} ERROR - 405:Method Not Allowed Traceback (most recent call last): File "/Users/siddharth/Projects/airflow/airflow/models.py", line 1299, in run result = task_copy.execute(context=context) File "/Users/siddharth/Projects/airflow/airflow/operators/http_operator.py", line 82, in execute self.extra_options) File "/Users/siddharth/Projects/airflow/airflow/hooks/http_hook.py", line 78, in run return self.run_and_check(session, prepped_request, extra_options) File "/Users/siddharth/Projects/airflow/airflow/hooks/http_hook.py", line 109, in run_and_check raise AirflowException(str(response.status_code)+":"+response.reason) AirflowException: 405:Method Not Allowed [2016-11-17 17:51:41,954] {models.py:1358} INFO - Marking task as UP_FOR_RETRY [2016-11-17 17:51:41,973] {models.py:1387} ERROR - 405:Method Not Allowed ```
FYI, next week is a short week. Happy to try to get this in before the holiday. Ping me on gitter when ready. I also need to look at your other PR, so may need some updates there.

@r39132 : I changed the connection url for the default http connection in the utils/db.py file to http://validate.jsontest.com/ , so you should resetdb to get it or just change it from the UI to the same thing.

Yep, I understand that. But, I'm suggesting an an additional change. Imagine someone that is already running Airflow in a QA env and say this change is included in the Airflow 1.8 release. We advise people to run `airflow upgradedb` as part of the upgrade process. They should expect any examples to still work without having to manually edit a connection. We don't expect people to blow their entire metadata db away or to know what to change this connection to.
Merged!
Awesome!  Thanks for your help on this everyone!

@vijaysbhat Nice! Testing now!

Works! And elegant fix as well! Thx for fixing this. +1

Merging.

@Jalepeno112 thx for updating the PR title - we actually need the commit subject to be changed in your commit message. When we do our releases, we compile the release notes from the commit message title lines. The JIRA id needs to be there for people to be able to refer to the JIRA and then find the associated PR and commit id.
@thoralf-gutierrez unfortunately as part of the cold-case PR cleanup we will close this if you don't respond in 5 days. I think this is a great PR to have and I would be sad to see it go.

@edparcell the code looks good to me aside from the existing comments. can you rebase this PR? then we can test and merge this.

as part of the cold-case PR cleanup, please respond within 5 days or we will close this for inactivity.

@r39132 sorry about that.  I changed the pull request title and didn't get around to changing the commit subject until just now.

For future reference though, the CONTRIBUTING.md file doesn't mention any of these steps nor does it contain a link to that Confluence page.  Would it be worth updating CONTRIBUTING.md to be in alignment with the information in that link?  I rarely enter the Confluence space so this is the first time that I've seen that link you provided.

@Jalepeno112 That's a good point. I suspect that's the reason why I often find myself reminding people. 

Feel free to submit an update to the CONTRIBUTING.md when you can and I can merge it. Also, you might want to change your commit to read

```
[AIRFLOW-638]  Add schema_update_options to GCP ops

Add schema_update_options to BigQueryBaseCursor and
GoogleCloudStorageToBigQueryOperator
```

I think there is a newline character after the [AIRFLOW-XXX] prefix. Also, it needs to be in the imperative mood : http://chris.beams.io/posts/git-commit/#seven-rules

@r39132 man I really messed this one up.  I was trying to squeeze this one in before the weekend and was moving too fast :)

Thanks for your patience and I will go ahead and do a separate pull request (and use the JIRA number, and imperative tense) to update CONTRIBUTING.md when I get the chance!

Great.
@r39132 thanks! I got an email from ASF git services that the PR got merged, but it's showing up as open over here. What gives?
@plypaul closing for now. Please reopen when you have time.
@r39132 Let me rebase, get you a config options and we already show execution time for triggered dags.
Tested the Show/Paused DAG behavior. It works well with the configuration as well.

The last run date column is a little confusing. IMO, it should be the Latest Execution Date. That is not what this column show however currently. Refer to the following Tree View and Overview snippet: The Latest Execution Date is `2016-11-19T00:00:00`. Granted there are gaps and failures, but those gaps and failures are accounted for in the `RECENT TASKS` and `DAG RUNS` columns on the overview page.

Testing the Trigger Dag for scheduled DAG is interesting... I have a daily dag that fires at midnight UTC. Since the start date for the DAG was 7 days ago, 7 daily dag runs executed. I then clicked the Trigger icon 4 times... The execution and start dates now reflect those of the recently triggered dag. The tree view show 11 runs, where the first 7 scheduled runs have green squares and circles with a black boundary. The 4 triggered runs are off schedule so they don't have a boundary.

@btallman This is almost ready. I request the following before I can merge this: 
* Why is the info icon on its own line in both the `Last Run` column title and in the value (i.e. under the execution date of `2016-11-20 15:23`)? In all other columns, the info icon is at the end of the column title text.
* Please change the info wording for `LAST_RUN` to read `Execution Date/Time of the Highest DAG Run`
* Please address all landscape linting errors. I see you are camel-casing... in python we snake-case. It might be a Java reflex:-)
* Finally, please add the new config param to TEST_CONFIG as well

Verified this works. 

The problem this fix addresses is described here : http://www.saltycrane.com/blog/2012/07/how-prevent-nose-unittest-using-docstring-when-verbosity-2/

Previous builds showed such as in https://api.travis-ci.org/jobs/177523464/log.txt?deansi=true showed the docstring not the test name - for example, look for `Subdags and subdag tasks can't both have a pool with 1 slot`, the docstring for `test_subdag_pools`

With this fix, the `test_subdag_pools` appears such as in the current PR's travis raw log : https://api.travis-ci.org/jobs/177538112/log.txt?deansi=true
Ping me once all 4 of the requested changes have been made.

I'm not sure what's the status here. Have end to end tests been added in another way to the airflow project ? If not, I still think it's a good idea to work on merging this PR.

Last time we discussed this, there were two outstanding issues if I recall correctly : 
1. We weren't sure where to have these end-to-end tests run. Since they take some time, we didn't want to have them run for each PR but there should be ways to at least run them nightly. I haven't kept up with the build and testing process since the project got into the Apache incubator so I can't comment yet here.
2. @mistercrunch wanted to have configuration rewritten to avoid "hacking" how configuration works for this PR. I haven't heard of whether this has been done or not in the mean time. If it has, I could spend some time trying to rebase this PR. @mistercrunch can you give us an update ?
@r39132  just a reminder
Awesome! Will wait for CI and then merge. :) Thanks!
LGTM waiting on CI

@alexvanboxel if you have a chance, please review. Some attention to the testing code would be nice as I am forced to reload some stuff in app.py just for testing. Nose keeps some things loaded into mem and I dont know a way around it except for this hack.

@r39132 : I can make the alembic change so the upgrade would change the URL. It may be a better idea to resolve this in a different way, for example running an example on a URL that we control and then only demonstrate the GET part?

@gtoonstra 

Right.. that's one approach too. I was also thinking about adding a demo endpoint to the web application that supports reads and writes but only used for this test. I'm okay with both approaches as it ensure we don't break in the future, though I like the ability to showcase reads and writes in the example -- hence I would lean to my latter suggestion of creating a new demo endpoint in the web app.

If you want to stick with using an external endpoints, we can make this more configurable in a few ways:

- Specifying it in a Variable. We will still need to seed the variable table, which means an alembic migration
- Specifying it in airflow.cfg, which I don't think is a good place for this just because we typically reserve that file for the airflow system (`i.e. webserver, scheduler, etc...`) and not for DAGs. We could create a new config file called config_dags.yml to hold configuration that can be read by dags, but then again, think the DB approach is cleaner.
- Other ideas?
Also interesting. If I clear DAGs, the manually triggered ones also get rerun. That makes sense since what is actually cleared are tasks, not dag runs.

To summarize,

- Why is the info icon on its own line in both the Last Run column title and in the value (i.e. under the execution date of 2016-11-20 15:23)? In all other columns, the info icon is at the end of the column title text. **(Done)**
- Please change the info wording for LAST_RUN to read Execution Date/Time of the Highest DAG Run  **(Done)**
- Please address all landscape linting errors. I see you are camel-casing... in python we snake-case. It might be a Java reflex:-)  **(Done)**
- Finally, please add the new config param to TEST_CONFIG as well  **(Done)**
Thx :-) Looking now!

@danielzohar Pls update the `PostgresTest`'s tests under `tests/operators/operators.py`. Just add a test around vacuum analyze and anything else you deem interesting. Refer to my example DAG below and my subsequent comment which shows how it runs.

```
# -*- coding: utf-8 -*-
#
# Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License");
# you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
# You may obtain a copy of the License at
#
# http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
#
# Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software
# distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
# WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
# See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
# limitations under the License.

from airflow import DAG
from airflow.operators.dummy_operator import DummyOperator
from airflow.operators.postgres_operator import PostgresOperator
from datetime import datetime, timedelta

now = datetime.now()
now_to_the_hour = (now - timedelta(0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 3)).replace(minute=0, second=0, microsecond=0)
START_DATE = now_to_the_hour 
DAG_NAME = 'test_dag_v2'

default_args = {
    'owner': 'airflow',
    'depends_on_past': True,
    'start_date': START_DATE,
}
dag = DAG(DAG_NAME, schedule_interval='*/10 * * * *', default_args=default_args)
sql = """
        CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS test_airflow (
            dummy VARCHAR(50)
        );
        """
t1 = PostgresOperator(task_id='postgres_operator_test', sql=sql, autocommit=True, dag=dag)

sql_2 = [
            "TRUNCATE TABLE test_airflow",
            "INSERT INTO test_airflow VALUES ('X')",
        ]

t2 = PostgresOperator(task_id='postgres_operator_test_t2', sql=sql_2, autocommit=True, dag=dag)
t2.set_upstream(t1)

sql_3 = [
            "VACUUM ANALYZE",
        ]

t3 = PostgresOperator(task_id='postgres_operator_test_t3', sql=sql_3, autocommit=True, dag=dag)
t3.set_upstream(t2)

```
Very simple test dag that: * creates a table * truncates the table * inserts records * calls vacuum analyze

I think most people will be OK with having them run on each commit to master, or running nightly. Let's ping the dev mailing list to check.

The hacks to conf do look a bit scary but I haven't reviewed them in detail yet

> I'm not sure what's the status here. Have end to end tests been added in another way to the airflow project ? If not, I still think it's a good idea to work on merging this PR.

We still don't have end to end tests; thanks for continuing to spend time on this

@r39132 

I think I'll go for the demo endpoint instead and use airflow updatedb to configure the new name for that endpoint. The only challenge there is that it will have to assume the default port 8080 for the web application, but we can add this as a comment to the http example dag.

@gtoonstra You shouldn't need to make an assumption about the port. The params below are all found in the airflow.cfg.

```
[webserver]
base_url = http://localhost:8080
web_server_host = 0.0.0.0
web_server_port = 8080
```

You can access them in your example dag as shown below:
```
from airflow import configuration as conf
port = conf.get('webserver', 'web_server_port')
```

@thoralf-gutierrez has been very patient! @zodiac I agree this will be good to have and great if you can champion it. We might just need a little scripting magic to switch out (or re-symlink) the airflow.cfg? Not sure.
